title.narrative: Provision of integrated shelter support to the most vulnerable people in NW Syria (under Envelope 1)

description.narrative:
**Mercy-USA for Aid and Development in this project will support the most vulnerable people in NW Syria in one component:
Provision of better dignified shelter solution by providing innovative shelter approach which comprises steel metal frame and sandwich panels: Module #2 "Design Attached" :Shelter unit size is 25.2 m2 from them 18.93 sq. meter for two rooms plus 6.3 m2 for kitchen, toilet, and bathroom- for 84 HH in Khateen Camp 120 HH in Al Furqan camp and 74 HH in Hyzan camp
The three targeted camps in Harbanush community within Maaret Tamsrin sub-district to accommodate 276 HH, 1892 individuals (Men 346- Women 392- Boys 472- Girls 682) with ramp where needed to ensure accessibility for people with disabilities in all shelter units and facilities, privacy, and safety for all vulnerable groups.
Leveling will be provided to the shelter ground with thickness of 15 cm with compaction and humidification for appropriate installation for shelter units
Lighting pools will be provided in the targeted camps for the main roads to ensure GBV mitigating and protection risks might arise
Furthermore, Mercy-USA will install special latrines from the Turkish type with handrails for persons with disability to access the facilities. The shelter units will be installed and infrastructure preparations, and shelter leveling by contractor.
*Accountability to Affected population (AAP) will be given high priority in this project by consultation, communications and sharing information with beneficiaries during all project phases, as well as using complaints and feedback mechanism which is accessible to all beneficiaries especially the most vulnerable such as persons with disabilities, the elderly, women and girls, thus taking corrective actions based on need. *HLP documents will be given high attention, so all HLP documents for all selected camp should be available to be cleared
